author: Amazon Customer

review: The Fire TV Stick is only good if you want to watch older movies. I am disappointed because I thought that you would actually be able to watch shows from A & E or Showtime but you have to be a subscriber to these channels. Also, the channels mentioned requires that you register at their website and enter your satellite carrier. Turns out I have DIRECTV and it is not one of the available carriers that can be registered. So really, I can watch a bunch of outdated movies and just clips from A & E and Showtime shows. I had hoped to replace DIRECTV with the Fire Stick to cut down on a monthly bill but I will be keeping DIRECTV. Even with Amazon Prime, you have to pay for rentals so there is the convenience of renting from your home TV or your computer, smart phone, etc. but if you are looking for a wider variety of newer releases, be prepared to pay.

review: Amazon Fire TV Stick has an incredibly easy set up and user interface for a great price! It's the perfect solution for a smart TV like my Sharp Aquos that comes with a limited list of apps that doesn't include Amazon. I checked into adding apps to my Sharp Smart TV but found out that it was impossible after calling their customer service.  I was so excited when I found out about the Amazon Fire TV Stick that would give me access to the apps I have wanted on my TV. THANK YOU AMAZON!
